HTML classes

Contains a number of classes to represent basic HTML nodes.

Summary
HTML classes
Contains a number of classes to represent basic HTML nodes.
HTMLNode
Base class for all HTML nodes.

Returns a string representation of the HTML of this node.

When this node’s condition is not met, it should be visibly hidden.

$attributes
An associative array of attribute names and their values.
$children
An array of all this node’s children.
$disableMethod
Determines what to do when this node’s condition is not met.
$condition
This node’s condition, determines when its contained inputs are relevant.

HTMLNode

Base class for all HTML nodes.

Summary
Functions
getHTML
Returns a string representation of the HTML of this node.
getConditionalStmt
Collects conditional statements.
getConversions
Collects value conversion statements.
getDefaults
Collects default input values.
plainClone
Clones this node and its children.
templateClone
Clones this node and its children, replacing template placeholders.

Functions

getHTML

abstract public function getHTML()

Returns a string representation of the HTML of this node.

getConditionalStmt

abstract public function getConditionalStmt($leafCallback)

Collects conditional statements.  Due to checks and conditions on nodes, certain statements related to HTMLInputs (such as validation and extracting form variables) should only be executed under certain conditions.  This function recurses through nodes and collects the statements and conditions.

Parameters

$leafCallbackA callback function executed when a HTMLInput is encountered.  This function should take a single HTMLInput parameter, and return the same as this function.

Returns

An array of associative arrays, with the keys: cond - The condition when the associated statements should be executed stmt - A Statement to execute.

getConversions

abstract public function getConversions()

Collects value conversion statements.

Normally, it is assumed that the actual value to be handled is equal to the value submitted in the form.  Some input types may have this different though, e.g. check inputs will actually use a boolean value equal to whether the input was set or not.  This function collects statements to be executed to convert these values.

Returns

An array of Statements to convert values.

getDefaults

abstract public function getDefaults()

Collects default input values.

Returns

An array with the keys being input names and the values the default value for that input.

plainClone

public function plainClone()

Clones this node and its children.  Performs a deep copy.

Note

It is a bit odd to have this functionusing the clone keyword and implementing __clone should work as well.  But due to some issues with templateClone and DescParser, this function is currently used.  This should be looked into.

templateClone

public function templateClone($params)

Clones this node and its children, replacing template placeholders.  Performs a deep copy.

Parameters

$paramsAn array with keys being the names of placeholder tags, and the values being HTMLNodes to replace them with.

HTMLText

Holds plain text.  HTML entities are automatically generated for special characters.

Summary
Functions
__construct

Functions

__construct

public function __construct($text)

Parameters

$textThe text contained in this node.  Should not contain HTML entities.

HTMLTag

General representation of HTML nodes.  This class is generally sufficient for holding HTML nodes.

Summary
Condition constants
Hide
When this node’s condition is not met, it should be visibly hidden.
Disable
When this node’s condition is not met, contained input controls should be disabled.

$attributes
An associative array of attribute names and their values.

Determines what to do when this node’s condition is not met.

This node’s condition, determines when its contained inputs are relevant.

makeTag
Creates a HTML string for a tag.

Condition constants

Hide

When this node’s condition is not met, it should be visibly hidden.

Disable

When this node’s condition is not met, contained input controls should be disabled.

Properties

Property: $type The type of tag, e.g.  ‘table’ or ‘em’.  May also be the empty string.

$attributes

An associative array of attribute names and their values.

$children

An array of all this node’s children.

$disableMethod

Determines what to do when this node’s condition is not met.  Should be set to Hide or Disable.

$condition

This node’s condition, determines when its contained inputs are relevant.

Functions

__construct

public function __construct($type)

Parameters

$typeThe type of tag.  If this is the empty string, this node will act as a simple container for other HTML nodes.  No conditions or attributes may be assigned.

Accessors

Method: getType Returns this node’s <$type>.

getChildren

public function getChildren()

Returns this node’s $children.

getCondition

public function getCondition()

Returns this node’s $condition.

getAttributes

public function getAttributes()

Returns this node’s $attributes.

Modifiers

replaceChild.

Replaces a child of this node with another.

Parameters

$idxThe index of the child to replace.
$newChildThe node that replaces the child.

addAttributes

public function addAttributes(/*DOMNamedNodeMap*/ $attribs)

Adds attributes to this node.

Parameters

$attribsMay be either an associative array of names/values, or a DOMNamedNodeMap, which contains tag attributes in the DOM.

addChildren

public function addChildren(array $nodes)

Adds child nodes.

Parameters

$nodesAn array of HTMLNodes that will be added as children.

setCondition

public function setCondition(Expression $cond)

Sets the condition for this node.

Parameters

$condThe new condition of this node.

Internal support functions

makeTag

protected function makeTag($type,  
$attributes,  
$innerHTML,  
$extraInnerTag =  '')

Creates a HTML string for a tag.

Parameters

$typeThe type of tag.
$attributesAn associative array of attribute names/values.
$innerHTMLA string contained within the tag.  If this is an empty string, the tag will also be empty (i.e., <tag />).
$extraInnerTagA string that will be included literally inside the start tag.
